title: Midnight at Thornwood Manor
description: A wealthy art collector is found dead during his own gallery opening. Among the guests are old friends, bitter rivals, and hidden enemies. Who silenced him forever?

setting.location: Thornwood Manor - a Victorian mansion converted into a private art gallery
setting.atmosphere: Elegant but tense, with whispered conversations and suspicious glances

characters.public_info: The victim's elegant wife of 20 years. Known for her charity work and impeccable taste.
characters.private_background: Your marriage has been loveless for years. Richard threatened to divorce you and leave you with nothing. You were negotiating a secret settlement with his lawyer.
secrets: You discovered Richard was planning to change his will
You have a secret bank account in Switzerland

relationships.marcus: You suspect he's been stealing from Richard
relationships.elena: She was once your friend, but you know she had an affair with Richard
relationships.james: He's always been kind to you

goals: Find out who really killed Richard

characters.private_background: Richard discovered you've been embezzling money for years. Tonight, he was going to expose you and press charges. You poisoned his wine during the toast.
secrets: You've stolen over $2 million from the business
You accessed Richard's wine glass during the toast
You have gambling debts to dangerous people

relationships.elena: She knows too much about the business finances
relationships.james: Richard's loyal dog - you don't trust him

goals: Survive the night without being caught

characters.public_info: A renowned art appraiser and long-time friend of the Thornwood family.
characters.private_background: You and Richard had a brief affair 5 years ago. You ended it, but Richard kept threatening to tell Victoria unless you authenticated some questionable art pieces for him.
secrets: You authenticated three forged paintings for Richard

relationships.victoria: You feel guilty about betraying her trust
relationships.marcus: You noticed irregularities in his expense reports

relationships.victoria: You respect her dignity despite the difficult marriage
relationships.marcus: You've been secretly investigating him for months
relationships.elena: You overheard her arguing with Richard last week

goals: Share what you saw at the right moment

victim.name: Richard Thornwood
victim.description: A 62-year-old wealthy art collector and gallery owner. Known for his sharp business sense and charming public persona, he had a darker side known only to those closest to him.

clues.name: Empty Vial
clues.description: A small glass vial hidden behind a potted plant near the bar. It smells faintly of bitter almonds.
clues.discovery_hint: Search around the bar area carefully
clues.reveals: The murder weapon was poison, likely cyanide

clues.name: Richard's Wine Glass
clues.description: The victim's wine glass still has residue. The rim shows a slight discoloration on one side.
clues.reveals: The poison was in the wine, applied to one side of the glass

clues.name: Hidden Financial Records
clues.description: Spreadsheets showing large discrepancies between reported and actual revenue over the past 3 years.
clues.reveals: Someone has been embezzling significant funds from Thornwood Art Acquisitions

clues.name: Threatening Letter
clues.description: A typed letter warning Richard to 'keep quiet or face consequences'. Dated one week ago.
clues.discovery_hint: Look in the paper shredder - it jammed
clues.reveals: Richard was being threatened by someone with something to hide

clues.name: Compromising Photographs
clues.description: Photos showing Richard with Elena in what appears to be a romantic setting.
clues.reveals: Richard and Elena had a relationship

clues.name: Casino Receipt
clues.description: A receipt from a casino showing a $50,000 loss. The name 'M. Chen' is printed on it.

clues.name: James's Notes
clues.description: Handwritten notes documenting suspicious activities, including 'MC touched R's glass at 9:15 PM'.
clues.discovery_hint: James seems nervous - perhaps he has something to share
clues.reveals: James witnessed Marcus near Richard's glass

locations.name: Main Gallery
locations.description: The grand hall where the gallery opening took place. Paintings line the walls, and a bar is set up in the corner. This is where Richard collapsed.

locations.name: Richard's Study
locations.description: A private office filled with papers, a large mahogany desk, and a paper shredder that seems to have jammed.

locations.name: Master Bedroom
locations.description: An elegantly decorated bedroom. Personal items and photographs are scattered around.

locations.name: Coat Room
locations.description: A small room near the entrance where guests' coats are stored.

timeline.event: Guests begin arriving at Thornwood Manor
Richard announces a toast to celebrate the new art acquisition
During the toast preparation, Marcus is seen near Richard's glass (witnessed by James)
Richard raises his glass and drinks
Richard collapses, glass shatters on the floor
Richard is pronounced dead. Police are called, no one can leave

solution.method: Cyanide poison applied to Richard's wine glass
solution.motive: Richard had discovered Marcus's years of embezzlement and was going to expose him at the gallery opening, ruining Marcus and sending him to prison
solution.full_explanation: Marcus Chen had been embezzling money from Thornwood Art Acquisitions for over three years to cover his gambling debts. When Richard discovered the theft, he confronted Marcus privately and threatened to reveal everything at tonight's gallery opening. Desperate, Marcus obtained cyanide and, during the chaos of the toast preparation at 9:15 PM, he applied the poison to one side of Richard's wine glass, knowing Richard always held his glass the same way. James Morrison witnessed Marcus near the glass but didn't understand the significance until after Richard's death. The empty vial was hastily hidden behind a potted plant, and Marcus hoped to destroy the financial evidence in the study before anyone could find it.

phases.intro_narration: The night was meant to be a celebration. Thornwood Manor glittered with lights as the city's elite gathered for Richard Thornwood's exclusive gallery opening. But at 9:25 PM, the champagne toast turned to screams as Richard collapsed, his wine glass shattering on the marble floor. Now, with the police on their way and the manor locked down, four people stand in the shadow of suspicion. The truth lies hidden in secrets, lies, and a deadly glass of wine. Can you uncover what really happened at Thornwood Manor?
